questions.text: 62 years old woman comes to her physician complaining of pain in her shoulder. They physician determines that there is tenderness just lateral to the acromia, and she indicates that she has pain when she attempts to abduct her arm. Injury to the tendon of which of the following muscles is most likely responsible for these findings?
questions.solution: From the supraspinous fossa of scapula, the tendon of the supraspinatus muscle passes laterallyunder the acromion to be attached to the greater tubercles of humerus. Therefore, injury to this tendon could cause pain during abduction ofthe arm. Note that the supraspinatus abducts the arm mainly in theinitial stage of abduction. It is commonly involved in rotator cuff injury. The tendon is separated from the arch and the deltoid muscle by the subacromial bursa. Therefore, inflammation of this bursa (subacromial bursitis) also makes abduction of the arm painful.

questions.text: A 72-year-old woman complaints that her right foot 'drags across the ground' when she walks. Which of the following nerves is most likely injured?
questions.solution: This is a case of 'foot drop'; it indicates that the muscles in the anterior compartment of the leg, that dorsiflex the foot at the ankle joint, have lost their nerve supply. The nerve supplying this compartment is the deep peroneal nerve, which is a branch of the common propenal nerve.

questions.text: Which of the following secretes surfactant in the respiratory passage?
questions.solution:
Primary function of Clara cells

  • To provide secretary Surfactant other specific proteins that contribute to the airway epithelial timing fluid
  • To serve as progenitor cells for ciliated & secretary epithelial cells
  • To metabolize xenobiotic within the lung

choices.text: Investing layer of deep cervical fascia
Condensation of the stroma of thyroid gland

questions.text: The suspensory ligament(of Berry) of the thyroid gland is a derivative of
questions.solution: Posteriorly, this investing fascia fuses with the thyroid capsule, forming a thick suspensory ligament for the thyroid gland known as the ligament of Berry. The ligaments are attached chiefly to the cricoid cartilage, and may extend to the thyroid cartilage.

questions.text: The right lung of a woman with carcinoma must be removed. During this surgical procedure, which of the following structures, passing immediately posterior to the root of the ling, is at the risk of being injured?
questions.solution: The vagus nerve is a complex homeostatic system, which operates via multiple neurotransmitters and affects several systems(cardiovascular, neuroendocrine, and immunologic). It can sese peripheral inflammation and transmits action potentials from the periphery to the brain stem. This in turn leads to the generation of action potentials in the descending vagus nerve, where proinflammatory cytokine production is inhibited. The vagus nerve sis known for its protective effects in many pathological conditions.

questions.text: The nuclei of III, IV, VI and XI cranial nerves are connected through which of the following fasciculi?
questions.solution: It connects the cranial nerve nuclei III(oculomotor nerve), IV (Trochlear nerve) and VI (Abducens nerve) together, and integrates movements directed by the gaze centers (frontal eye filed) and information about head movement (from cranial nerve VIII, Vestibulocochlear nerve). It is an integral component of saccadic eye movements as well as vestibulo-ocular and optokinetic reflexes.

questions.text: A penetrating knife wound to the posterior shoulder in the quadrangular space would damage the axiliary nerve and the
questions.solution: The posterior circumflex humeral artery is a branch of the third part of axillary artery. It accompanies the axillary nerve through the quadrangular space, The artery contributes to the collateral blood supply around the shoulder. The artery and nerve are often damaged by fracture of the surgical neck of the humerus

questions.text: Meralgiaparasthetica is due to involvement of
questions.solution: The lateral cutaneous nerve of thigh, a branch of lumbar plexus gets contribution from L1 and L2 segments of the spinal. It descends along the lateral border. Of the psoas major muscle and enters the thigh after passing deep to the fascia iliaca and the inguinal ligament. Sometimes the nerves are incorporated within the substance of the fascia iliaca and placed in fibrous tunnel of the inguinal ligament. Irritating of this nerve in the fibrous tunnel produces pain along the lateral aspect of thigh. This is known as Meralgiaparasthetica. Freeing the nerve from the fibrous tunnel will relive the symptoms. While doing laparoscopic surgery for inguinal hernia, accidental damage to the nerve in the 'triangle of pain'(a non-anatomical triangle described by the laparoscopic surgeon) can cause pain and tingling sensation in the area of its innervations.

questions.text: Which of the following is a syndesmosis?
questions.solution:
1. superior tibiofibular joint – plane
  2. inferior tibiofibular joint- syndesmosis
  3. superior radioulnar joint – Pivot
  4. inferior radioulnar joint- Pivot

questions.text: A man elderly woman presents in the emergency room with dizziness and nystagmus. Examination reveals a loss of pain and temperature sensation over the right side of the face and the left side of the body. The patient exhibits ataxia and intention tremor on the right in both the upper and lower extremities and is unable to performs either the finger-to-nose or heel to shin tasks on the right. In addition, she is hoarse and demonstrates papillary constriction and drooping of the eyelid on the right. Finally, the right side of her face is drier than the left. Which of the following artery block would explain the patient's condition?
questions.solution: It is lateral medullary syndrome on right side & hence Right posterior inferior cerebellar artery is the cause

questions.text: The following structure marked with a red arrow is derived from ______________ branchial pouch.
questions.solution: The image shows marking at thymus which is derived from third brachial pouch.

questions.text: A 57-year-old man presents with sudden onset of severe and central chest pain radiating to the back. ECG shows ST segment elevation in lead VI-V6, I, aVI. The chest X-ray shows a widened mediastinum. The diagnosis is:
questions.solution:
The ECG finding of ST Elevation prompts diagnosis of Myocardial infarction. But the CXR showing mediastinal widening is the key word which favors diagnosis as tear in the aorta.



The answer is aortic dissection which exhibits a retrograde extension that can affect the coronary artery and can explain the resultant MI in this patient.

questions.text: A young computer operator presents with tingling sensation and paresthesia on medial side of hand. Which structure in most likely affected?
questions.solution:
• Carpal tunnel syndrome, also called median nerve compression, is a condition that causes numbness, tingling, or weakness in the hand.
  • It happens because of pressure on the median nerve, which runs the length of the arm, goes through a passage in the wrist called the carpal tune, and ends in the hand.

questions.text: In a patient with Fracture of upper radius and ulna at the insertion of pronator teres muscle. Which movement is restricted:
questions.solution:
• Pronator teres muscle is involved in pronation of forearm, by rotating the radius medially on the ulna,
  • Proximally movements at the humeroradial joint and distally at radioulnar joints pronate and supinate the hand.
  • In pronation, the radius turns anteromedially and obliquely across the ulna
  • Proximal end remains lateral to the ulna while its distal end lies medially and the interosseous membrane become spiralled
  • If there is fracture at the pronator muscle insertion area
  1. it may be d4etachd
  2. Forearm acquired supination.
  • The movement pronation is restricted.

questions.text: Which of the following nerve is known as criminal nerve of grassi?
questions.solution:
• The “criminal nerve” of Grassi is the first gastric branch of the posterior vagus nerve. This nerve may branch proximal or distal to the celiac division of the posterior vagus nerve.
  • The importance of this nerve is during Truncal vagotomy, since failure to transect the nerve of Grassi proximal to its origin will result in an incomplete vagotomy.

choices.text: Taste sensation of anterior 2/3rd of tongue

questions.text: Which of the following is not a test for integrity of 7th and 9th nerve?
questions.solution:
• Facial nerve gives sensory supply to tongue
  • Chorda tympani nerve is a sensory branch of facial nerve (CN VII) which gives taste sensation of anterior 2/3rd of tongue
  • Glossopharyngeal nerve (CN IX) gives the taste sensation from posterior 2/3rd tongue
  • Motor supply to tongue is by hypoglossal; nerve (CN XII). Injury to hypoglossal nerve paralyze ipsilateral half of tongue
  • If CN XII is functioning normally, tongue protrudes evenly in midline
  • If CN XII is parleyed: when tongue is protruded, its tip deviates towards the paralyzed side because of unopposed action of genioglossus muscles on the normal side of tongue.(TDS)

questions.text: FAILURE OF CLOSURE OF ROSTRAL NEUROPORE AT 25TH DAY LEADS TO?
questions.solution:
CRANIAL NEUROPORE CLOSES BY DAY 25

CAUDAL NEUROPORE CLOSES BY DAY 28

FAILURE OF CRANIAL NEUROPORE TO CLOSE AT DAY 25 RESULTS IN ANENCEPHALY

FAILURE OF CAUDAL NEUROPORE TO CLOSE RESULTS IN SPINA BIFIDA

questions.text: URINARY BLADDER IS SUPPLIED BY WHICH BRANCHES OF LUMBAR PLEXUS?
questions.solution:
NERVE SUPPLY OF URINARY BLADDER



  • THEY CONSIST OF BOTH SYMPATHETIC AND PARASYMPATHETIC COMPONENTS, EACH OF WHICH CONTAINS BOTH EFFERENT AND AFFERENT FIBRES
  • PARASYMPATHETIC FIBRES ARISE FROM THE SECOND TO THE FOURTH SACRAL SEGEMENTS OF THE SPINAL CORD AND ENTER THE PELVIC PLEXUS ON THE POSTEROLATERAL ASPECTS OF THE RECTUM AS THE PELVIC SPLANCHNIC NERVES OR NERVI ERIGENTES.
  • THE SYMPATHETIC FIBRES ARE DERIVED FROM THE LOWER THREE THORACIC AND UPPER TWO LUMBAR SEGMENTS OF THE SPINAL CORD.

questions.text: A 25 YR OLD INVOLVED IN A ROAD FIGHT CAME TO THE EMERGENCY WITH PAIN SWELLING AND TENDERNESS OVER THE NOSE REGION. ON EXAMINATION HE WAS DIAGNOSED TO HAVE SUFFERED INJURY TO THE NASAL SEPTUM. AMONG THE BELOW GIVEN OPTIONS WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING DO NOT FROM A PART OF NASAL SEPTUM?
questions.solution: NASAL SEPTUM IS A OSSEOCATLAGENOUS STRUCTURE CONTRIBUTED BY

questions.text: CAVERNOUS SINUS IS A COLLECTION OF VENOUS SINUSES ON EITHER SIDE OF PITUITARY. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING DOES NOT PASS THROUGH THE LATERALWALL OF THE CAVERNOUS SINUS?
questions.solution:
• THE FREE FLOATING STRUCTURE IIN CAVERNOUS SINUS IS CRANIAL NERVE VI AND INTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY
  • THE CRANIAL NERVES III, IV, V2 AND POST GANGLIONIC FIBRES PASS THROUGH THE LATERAL WALL OF THE CAVERNOUS SINUS

choices.text: VALVES ARE PRESENT AT THE JUNCTION OF SUPERIOR MESENTRIC ARTERY AND SPLENIC ARTERY
VALVES ARE PRESENT IN THE INTRAHEPATIC SYSTEM
THERE ARE ABOUT 10-12 VALVES ALONG THE ENTIRE COURSE

questions.text: WHICH IS TRUE REGARDING PORTAL VENOUS SYSTEM?
questions.solution:
• IN ADULT, THE PORTAL VEIN AND ITS TRIBUTARIES HAVE NO VALVES
  • IN FETAL LIFE AND FOR SHORT POSTNATAL PERIOD VALVES ARE DEMONSTRABLE IN ITS TRIBUTARIES, BUT THEY USUALLY GET ATROPHIED
  • RARELY SOME PERSIST IN AN ATROPHIC FORM INTO ADULT HOOD

questions.text: MIDDLE MENINGEAL ARTERY IS A BRANCH OF ?
questions.solution:
MAXILLARY ARTERY (A BRANCH OF EXTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY) HAS 5 BRANCHES FROM THE FIRST GROUP

>MIDDLE MENINGEAL ARTERY

>ACCESORY MENINGEAL ARTERY

>ANTERIOR TYMPANIC BRANCH

>DEEP AURICULAR ARTERY

>INFERIOR ALVEOLAR ARTERY

questions.text: A PREMATURE INFANT IS BORN WITH PATENT DUCTUS ARTERIOSUS. ITS CLOSURE IS STIMULATED BY THE ADMINISTRATION OF PROSTAGLANDIN INHIBITORS. DUCTUS ARTERIOSUS DEVELOPS FROM WHICH PHARYNGEAL ARCH ARTERY

choices.text: RIGHT SIDED LOSS OF WRINKLES ON FOREHEAD & RIGHT SIDED CORNER OF MOUTH GOES DOWN
RIGHT SIDED LOSS OF WRINKLES ON FOREHEAD & RIGHT SIDED CORNER OF MOUTH GOES UP
LEFT SIDED LOSS OF WRINKLES ON FOREHEAD & LEFT SIDE CORNER OF MOUTH GOES DOWN
LEFT SIDED LOSS OF WRINKLES ON FOREHEAD & RIGHT SIDED CORNER OF MOUTH GOES UP

questions.text: A LESION IN LEFT SIDED MOTOR NUCLEUS OF FACIAL NERVE LEADS TO:
questions.solution: LESION TO THE MOTOR NUCLEUS OF FACIAL NERVE CAUSES LOWER MOTOR NEURON LESION IN WHICH THERE IS COMPLETE HEMIPLEGIA OF THE IPSILATERAL FACE WHEREAS IN UPPER MOTOR NEURON LESION THERE IS HEMIPLEGIA OF THE CONTRALATERAL MID AND LOWER FACE

questions.text: WHICH STRUCTURE PASSES SUPERFICIAL TO FLEXOR RETINACULUM?
questions.solution: ULNAR NERVE PASSES ABOVE (SUPERFICIAL) TO THE FLEXOR RETINACULUM ESPECIALLY THE PALMAR CUTANEOUS BRANCH OF ULNAR NERVE

questions.text: ARTERIA THYROIDEA IMA ORIGINATES FROM
questions.solution:
BLOOD SUPPLY OF THE THYROID GLAND

  • SUPERIOR THYROID ARTERY IS FIRST BRANCH OF EXTERNAL CAROTID ARTERY AND ENTERS THE GLAND NEAR SUPERIOR POLE AS A LARGE ANTERIOR BRANCH AND A SMALLER POSTERIOR BRANCH
  • INFERIOR THYROID ARTERY, A BRANCH OF THYROCERVICAL TRUNK OF SUBCLAVIAN ARTERY PASSES BEHIND THE CAROTID SHEATH RUNNING MEDIALLY REACHING THE POSTEROLATERAL ASPECT OF THE GLAND.
  • THYROIDEA IMA ARTERY, A BRANCH OF AORTA OR BRACHIOCEPHALIC ARTERY ENTERS THE ISTHMUS OR LOWER POLE OF ONE OF THE LATERAL LOBES
  • TRACHEAL AND ESOPHAGEAL BRANCHES SERVE BLOOD SUPPLY TO RETAINED THYROID GLAND AFTER THYROIDECTOMY

questions.text: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING STRUCTURES PASS THROUGH THE LESSER SCIATIC NOTCH?
questions.solution:
TENDON OF OBTURATOR INTERNUS PASSES THROUGH LESSER SCIATIC NOTCH.

REST ALL OPTIONS PASS THROUGH GREATER SCIATIC NOTCH.

OTHER STRUCTURES WHICH PASS THROUGH LESSER SCIATIC NOTCH ARE

  1. PUDENDAL NERVE
  2. INTERNAL PUDENDAL VESSELS
  3. NERVE TO OBTURATOR INTERNUS

questions.text: A 35 YR OLD CHRONIC ALCOHOLIC HAS MULTIPLE EPISODES OF VOMITING AFTER BINGE DRINKING. THE LAST EPISODE OF VOMITING HAD BLOOD IN IT AND HE GOT ALARMED ON SEEING IT. ON EXAMINATION HE IS ANXIOUS, DIAPHORETIC, VITALS ARE STABLE. PER ABDOMEN EXAMINATION REVEALS PRESENCE OF ENLARGED SPLEEN WITH FREE FLUID IN THE ABDOMEN. WHAT IS THE SOURCE OF BLEDING IN THIS PATIENT?
questions.solution:
ALCOHOLIC WITH HEMATEMESIS AND SPLENOMEGALY IMPLIES THE DEVELOPMENT OF PORTAL HYPERTENSION.

THE DILATED VEINS OVER ANTERIOR ABDOMINAL WALL ARE CAPUT MEDUSA AND THE REASON HE BLED IS BECAUSE OF RUPTURE OF OESOPHAGEAL VARICES. BOTH OF THESE ARE DUE TO FROMATION OF PORTOSYSTEMIC COLLATERALS. THE ONES IN THE LOWER OESOPHAGEAL ARE THIN WALLED AND ARE PRONE TO RUPTURE LEADING TO HEMATEMESIS

questions.text: AN 85 YEAR OLD MAN PRESENT WITH A SUDDEN ONSET OF SEVERE OCCIPITAL HEADACHE AND HAS VOMITED ON TWO OCCASION SINCE THE HEADACHE BEGAN. HE COMPLAINS OF DOUBLE VISION. HIS EXAMINATION FINDINGS ARE AS FOLLOWS:GLASSGOW COMA SCALE 15/15 NECK STIFFNESS PRESENT COMMENT ON WHERE IS THE LIKELY SITE OF PATHOLOGY?
questions.solution:
VOMITING AND HEADACHE OF SUDDEN ONSET POINTS TO CNS EVENT AND POSSIBLE RAISED ICP

NECK STIFFNESS OF SUDDEN ONSET INABSENCE OF FEVER IS SUGGESTIVE OF SUBARACHNOID HAEMORRHAGE

DOUBLE VISION IS DUE TO CRANIAL NERVE PALSY AND NOTICE THE LEFT EYE DEVIATING DOWNWARD AND OUTWARD IMPLYING OCULOMOTOR NERVE PARALYSIS OF LEFT SIDE

THIS CAN BE EXPLAINED BY ANEURYSM IN LEFT POSTERIOR COMMUNICATING ARTERY WHICH RUNS ADJACENT TO OCULOMOTOR NERVE AND ITS RUPTURE HAS CAUSED BOTH CRANIAL NERVE PALSY APART FROM BLOOD IN MENINGES LEADING TO NECK STIFFNESS

questions.text: A 14 YR OLD MALE NEONATE IS BROUGHT TO YOUR OPD WITH MOTHER NOTICING THAT WHEN THE CHILD URINATES SOME FLUID THAT SMELLS LIKE URINE ALSO ESCAPES FROM THE UMBILICUS OF BABY AND CAUSING SOILING OF CLOTHES. YOU MAKE A PROVISIONAL DIAGNOSIS OF URINARY FISTULA. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS PRESENTATION?
questions.solution:
PATENT URACHUS WILL CAUSE URINE TO LEAK FROM THE UMBILICUS

OPTION B WILL CAUSE FECAL DISCHARGE FROM UMBILICUS

OPTION C FORMS COWPER GLANDS IN MALE AND BARTHOLIN GLANDS IN FEMALE

OPTION D FORMS GUBERNACULUM IN MALES AND OVARIAN AND ROUND LIGAMENTS IN FEMALES

URACHUS IS A REMNANT OF A CHANNEL BETWEEN THE BLADDER AND THE UMBILICUS WHERE URINE INITIALLY DRAINS IN THE FETUS DURING FIRST TRIMESTER OF PREGNANCY. THE CHANNEL OF THE URACHUS USUALLY SEALS OFF AND OBLITERATES AROUND 12 TH WEEK OF GESTATION AND ALL THAT IS LEFT IS A SMALL FIBROUS CORD BETWEEN THE BLADDER AND UMBILICUS CALLED THE MEDIAN UMBILICAL LIGAMENT

questions.text: A 26 YR OLD MAN IS BEING TREATED WITH CHEMOTHERAPY FOR HODGKINS LYMPHOMA. DURING HIS TREATMENT HE HAS SEVERE VOMITING. WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING AREAS OF THE BRAIN IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MULTIPLE EPISODES OF VOMITING ?
questions.solution: AREA POSTREMA IS KNOWN AS CHEMORECEPTOR TRIGGER ZONE AND LEADS TO SEVERE VOMITING EPISODES. IT IS A V SHAPED BAND OF TISSUE ON LATERAL WALLS PF FOURTH VENTRICLE. IT LIES OUTSIDE THE BLOOD BRAIN BARRIER AND HENCE CAN BE IRRITATED BY CHENOTHERAPEUTIC AGENTS

questions.text: MR.X WAS INJURED IN A CAR ACCIDENT SEVERAL MONTHS AGO. NOW WHEN HE SPEAKS, THOUGH FLUENTLY, THE SENTENCES SEEMED MUDDLED AND DON'T MAKE SENSE. HE ALSO SOMETIMES MAKEUP WORDS, ALTHOUGH HE SEEMS UNAWARE OF HIS SPEECH DIFFICULTIES. WHICH AREA OF BRAIN WAS MOST LIKELY DAMAGES IN THE PATIENT CAR ACCIDENT?
questions.solution:
A. SINCE FLUENCY IS PRESERVED IN THIS PATIENT, OPTION A IS RULED OUT

àTHE DESCRIPTION GIVEN IS OF WORD SALAD OR JARGON SPEECH WHERE PATIENT IS CREATING NEW WORDS. THIS IS A FEATURE OF WERNICKES AREA BEING DAMAGED

àOPTION C IS RULED OUT AS THERE IS NO MENTION OF REPETITION BEING IMPAIRED

àOPTION D IS RULED OUT AS ADULTS WHO SUFFER DAMAGE TO THE PREFRONTAL CORTEX DEVELOP PROBLEMS WITH MAKING DECISIONS AND WITH BEHAVING APPROPRIATELY IN SOCIAL SITUATIONS

choices.text: VARICOCELE AND LEFT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO RIGHT TESTICULAR VEIN
VARICOCELE AND LEFT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO LEFT RENAL VEIN
VARICOCELE AND LEFT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO IVC
VARICOCELE AND LEFT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO PAMPINIFORM PLEXUS OF RIGHT SIDE

questions.text: A 30 YEAR OLD BODY BUILDER PRESENTS WITH COMPLAINTS OF DRAGGING SENSATION IN LEFT TESTIS. ON EXAMINAITON BAG OF WORMS SENSATION IS FELT WHILE EXAMINING THE LEFT SCROTAL SAC. WHAT IS THE DIAGNOSIS AND WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS CORRECT?
questions.solution:
THE LEFT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO LEFT RENAL VEIN. THE RIGHT TESTICULAR VEIN DRAINS INTO RIGHT RENAL VEIN.

IN CASE OF LEFT SIDED VARICOCELE, IT IS IMPORTANT TO ALWAYS RULE OUT RENAL CELL CANCER.

questions.text: A 50 YEAR OLD POLICE MAN COMES FROM DUTY WITH COMPLAINT OF PAIN IN RIGHT LEG AND STARTS FROM RIGHT BUTTOCK. ON EXAMINATION PULSE IN RIGHT POPLITEAL FOSSA WAS ABSENT, WHERE AS IN LEFT SIDE IT WAS NORMAL. THE BLOCK IS AT WHICH LEVEL?
questions.solution:
SUDDEN BLOCKAGE OF THE LOWER AORTA WHERE IT DIVIDES INTO THE COMMON ILIAC ARTERIES CAUSES BOTH LEGS TO SUDDENLY BECOME PAINFUL, PALE AND COLD

NO PULSE CAN BE FELT IN THE LEGS, WHICH MAY BECOME NUMB.

SUDDEN BLOCKAGE OF AN ILIAC ARTERY CAUSES SYMPTOMS IN ONLY ONE LEG. THESE SYMTPOMS INDICATE A MEDICAL EMERGENCY.

questions.text: A PATIENT WAS HIT IN EYE WITH A TENNIS BALL. FOLLOWING THIS BLUNT INJURY HE DEVELOPED HYPHEMA. WHICH BLOOD VESSEL IS THE SOURCE OF BLEEDING?
questions.solution: THE SOURCE OF HYPHEMA IN BLUNT TRAUMA TO THE EYE IS FROM CIRCULUS IRIDIS MAJOR.

questions.text: A 40 YEAR OLD MALE CAME TO THE OPD WITH COMPLAINTS OF PAIN AND BLEEDING DURING DEFECATION.THE PATIENT COMPLAINTS OF FEELING OF SOMETHING COMING OUT DURING DEFECATION. ON PROCTOSCOPIC EXAMINATION THE PATIENT WAS DIAGNOSED TO HAVE HEMORRHOIDS. WHAT COULD THE SOURCE OF BLEEDING IN THIS PATIENT?
questions.solution:
SOURCE OF BLEEDING IN HEMARRHOIDS ARE USUALLY THE INTERNAL HEMARRHOIDS WHICH ARE SYMPTOMATIC ANAL CUSHION AND LIE IN 3,7, AND 11 CLOCK POSITION.

HEMORRHOIDS DEVELOP DUE TO DEGENERATION OF THE SUPPORTING CONNECTIVE TISSUE OF ANAL CUSHION.

THIS DEGENERTAIONCAUSES DOWNWARD DISPLACEMENT OF THE CUSHION AND ABNORMAL VENOUS DILATATION

THE SUPERIOR HEMORRHOIDAL VEIN DRAINS THE UPPER HALF ON ANAL CANAL ABOVE THE DENTATE LINE PASSES UPWARDS TO BECOME THE RECTAL VEIN. THESE UNITE TO BECOME SUPERIOR RECTAL VEIN WHICH LATER BECOMES INFERIOR MESENTERIC VEIN

questions.text: MUSCLES WITH PARALLEL FUBRES ARE ALL EXCEPT?
questions.solution:
TIBIALIS ANTERIOR MUSCLE IS A MULTIPENNATE MUSCLE WITH OBLIQUE FIBRES

MUSCLES WITH PARALLEL FASCICULI EXAMPLES:

STRAP MUSCLES LIKE STERNOYOID AND SARTORIUS

STRAP LIKE WITH TENDINOUS INSERTION EX:RECTUS ABDOMINIS

questions.text: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS FALSE REGARDING THE BOUNDSRIES OF THE CUBITAL FOSSA

A 16 YR OLD WAS BORUGHT TO OPD WITH COMPLAINTS OF AMENORRHEA. ON EXAMINATION UNDERDEVELOPED SECONDARY SEXUAL CHARACTER. BROAD CHEST AND LOWER HAIR LINE WAS OBSERVED.ON DETAILED RADIOLOGICAL EXAMINATION THE PATIENT WAS DIAGNOSED TO HAVE THE FOLLOWING WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING VESSELS PREVENTS THE ASCENT OF THE KIDNEY?
questions.solution:
Horseshoe kidney is a condition in which the kidneys fuse(bind)together at the bottom, forming a 'U' shape or horseshoe shape. Children who have horseshoe kidney have one 'fused' kidney instead of 2 separate kidneys.

Horseshoe kidney is a congenital condition, which means it happens before birth while the baby is still developing inside the mother’s womb.

ISTHMUS OF THE KIDNEY USUALLY LIES AT L3 LEVEL.

ON IVP HAND SHAKING SIGN IS SEEN

questions.text:
A YOUNG MALE WHO HAD HEAD ON COLLISON DURING RTA WAS BROUGHT TO THE EMERGENCY. ON EXAMINATION HIS GCS WAS LOW. ON ENQUIRY THE PATIENT WAS HAVING SEVERE HEADACHE AND HIS RELATIVES INFORMED THAT HE HAD A PERIOD OF UNCONSCIOUSNESS FOLLOWING WHICH THE PATIENT BECAME UNCONSCIOUS. RADIOLOGICAL IMAGE HAS BEEN INCLUDED BELOW.

WHAT IS THE DIAGNOSIS AND SOURCE OF BLEEDING IN THIS CASE?
questions.solution:
Extradural hematoma(EDH), also known as an epidural hematoma, is a collection of blood that forms between the inner surface of the skull and outer layer of the dura, which is called the endosteal layer. They are usually associated with a history of head trauma and frequently associated skull fracture. The source of bleeding is usually arterial, most commonly from a torn middle meningeal artery.

EDHs are typically biconvex in shape and can cause a mass effect with herniation. They are usually limited by cranial sutures, but not by venous sinuses. Both CT and MRI are suitable to evaluate EDHs. When the blood clot is evacuated promptly(or treated conservatively when small), the prognosis of EDHs is generally good.

choices.text: MANDIBULAR PROCESS TO FUSE WITH THE LATERAL NASAL PROCESS
MANDIBULAR PROCESS TO FUSE WITH THE MEDIAL NASAL PROCESS
MAXILLARY PROCESS TO FUSE WITH THE LATERAL NASAL PROCESS
MAXILLARY PROCESS TO FUSE WITH THE MEDIAL NASAL PROCESS

questions.text: IN A PATIENT BORN WITH LEFT CLEFT OF TH EUPPER LIP AND LEFT ANTERIOR CLEFT OF THE PRIMARY PALATE,THE MOST LIKELY CAUSE IS FAILURE OF?
questions.solution:
Cleft lip and cleft palate are openings or splits in the upper lip, the roof of the mouth (palate) or both. Cleft lip and cleft palate result when facial structures that are developing in an unborn baby don't close completelY.

Cleft lip and cleft palate are among the most common birth defects. They most commonly occur as isolated birth defects but are also associated with many inherited genetic conditions or syndromes.

CLEFT LIP OCCURS DUE TO DEFECT IN THE FUSION OF MEDIAL NASAL PROCESS AND MAXILLARY PROCESS

CLEFT PALATE IS DUE TO FAILURE OF FUSION OF PALATAL PROCESS OF THE MAXILLA.

questions.text: WHILE MAKING A HORIZONTAL INCISION FOR C-SECTION SKIN IN THEH LOWER PART OF THE ANTERIOR ABDOMINAL WALL. WHICH OF THE CUTANEOUS NERVE ARE AT THE GREATEST RISK OF DAMAGE?
questions.solution:
ORIGIN:ILIOINGUINAL NERVE ALONG WITH ILIOHYPOGASTRIC NERVE ARISES FROM THE ANTERIOR RAMUS OF L1

Symptoms of ilioinguinal nerve injury include:Burning or stabbing pain, numbness, or tingling in the lower abdomen and groin. Difficulty extending the back as this movement causes more pain. Difficulty with sitting, standing and walking.

questions.text: THE APPEARANCE OF WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS CONSIDERED AS THE INITIAL SIGN FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE RESPIRATORY SYSTEM?
questions.solution:
THE APPEARANCE OF THE LARYNGOTRACHEAL DIVERTICULUM IS REGARDED AS THE FIRST SIGN OF THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE RESPIRATORY SYSTEM.

THE RESPIRATORY SYSTEM IS DERIVED FROM TWO SOURCES

A.ENDODERM

B. SPLANCHNOPLEURIC INTRA EMBRYONIC MESODERM

questions.text: THE ABOVE HISTOLOGICAL PICTURE IS SEEN WITH?
questions.solution:
SMOOTH MUSCLE CONSISTS OF SPINDLE SHAPED MYOCYTES

THE ABOVE HISTOLOGICAL IMAGE IS OF SMOOTH MUSCLES

THEY FORM A MAJOR COMPONENT OF DIGESTIVE TRACT, RESPIRATORY TRACT, BLOOD VESSELS.
The most common cause of scapular winging is paralysis of the serratus anteriormuscle due to the injury of the long thoracic nerve.

questions.text: A 12-year-old came to your OP with complaints of swelling and pain in the lower jaw since the past 15 days. She is experiencing difficulty in mastication. The swelling is non-pulsatile with smooth surface texture. It does not move with swallowing or deglutition. On palpation, surface temperature was not raised, non-tender, soft in consistency, fluctuant, compressible, and not reducible. No secondary changes were noted. What could be the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Branchial cleft cysts are congenital epithelial cysts, which arise on the lateral part ofthe neck from a failure of obliteration of the second branchial cleft in embryonicdevelopment

A branchial cleft cyst is a common cause of soft tissue swelling in the neck of a young adult

questions.text: PATELLA IS AN EXAMPLE OF WHICH TYPE OF BONE?
questions.solution:
PATELLA IS TRIANGULAR IN SHAPE AND LIES IN THE PATELLO FEMORAL GROOVE.

PATELLA IS A SESAMOID BONE WHICH IS FORMED WITH IN THE TENDON OF QUADRICEPS FEMORIS MUSCLE.

THE CONVEX ANTERIOR SURFACE IS PERFORATED BY MANY NUTRIENT VESSELS.

ANTERIOR TO THE PATELLA LIES THE PREPATELLAR BURSA WHICH SEPERATES IT FROM THE SKIN

questions.text: PITUITARY DEVELOPS FROM
questions.solution:
THE ANTERIOR PITUATARY AND INTERMEDIATE LOBE OF PITUATARY DEVELOPS FROM RATHKE POUCH, WHICH IS INITIALLY DERIVED FROM THE ANTERIOR NEURAL RIDGE, ADJACENT TO CELLS IN THE NEURAL PLATE

>NEURAL PLATE CONTRIBUTES TO VENTRAL DIENCEPHALON

>POSTERIOR LOBE OF PITUATARY DEVELOPS FROM THE INFUNDIBULUM, AN EVAGINATION OF THE VENTRAL DIENCEPHALON.

questions.text: ADRENAL MEDULLA IS DERIVED FROM
questions.solution:
THE ADRENAL CORTEX DEVELOPS FROM THE MESODERM AND SECRETES CORTICOSTEROIDS AND ANDROGENS

THE ADRENAL MEDULLA DERIVES FROM NEURAL CREST CELLS AND SECRETES CATECHOLAMINES(MOSTLY EPINEPHRINE)

questions.text: THE MOVEMENT AT WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING JOINTS PERMIT A PERSON YO SAY NO BY HEAD MOVEMENT?
questions.solution:
ATLANTO-OCCIPITAL(BETWEEN SKULL AND C1)JOINT PERMITS NODDING OF HEAD(AS WHEN INDICATING APPROVAL OR YES)

ATLANTOAXIAL JOINT PERMITS THE HEAD TO BE TURNED FROM SIDE TO SIDE I.E ROTATION.9AS INDICATING DISAPPROVAL, THE NO MOVEMENT)
